results.title: Sausalito
results.brief_description: Utilising an imaginative rather than a realistic approach, the director Frank Stauffacher, one of the leading experimental film makers in the United States, seeks to capture the atmosphere of Sausalito, a small village on the shore of San Francisco Bay. The film is divided into two sections; Landscape and Song and uses slow motion, split screen, and superimposition techniques. It consists of fragments of visual and auditory experience such as the lapping of water on the shore, the creaking redwood of old houses.

results.title: Saudi Arabia: the oil revolution
results.creator_credit: Antony Thomas and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Probes the internal tension of Saudi Arabia, in transition since the oil boom of the mid 1960s and the reforms of King Faisal. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Saturday parade
results.brief_description: A candid camera study with mood music of the Cape Town Parade on a typical Saturday. The second hand stalls and flower market; street sweepers; the carillon; street artists and photographers; children; the “table-cloth” coming down on Table Mountains; a hamburger stand and a horse cab a night.

results.title: Saturday night again
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Richard Davis and Laughing Kookaburra Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at situations that could result in drink-driving, and also looks at the other options available through following the social life of a young Sydney group of friends made up of four males and one female in their late teens to early twenties. Covers willingness to intervene in a drink-driving situation; ability to say “no” to someone who wants to drive when he or she is unfit to do so; and alternative ways of spending an evening socialising without the risk of drink-driving. Features Gia Carrides. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Satori in the right cortex
results.creator_credit: Kalle Lasn, Don Hopkins, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Satori is a sudden flash of intuitive enlightment—the spiritual goal of Zen Buddhism. This documentary yields insight into the Japanese way of being. Oblique and impressionistic in style, short scenes reflect Japan’s striking contrasts and contradictions. Narration is minimal. Filmed are: monks within a Zen Buddhist monastery; Shintoist and Buddhist street festivals; masked rituals; the Zen-based Kanrisha School of Business Management; and a Shinto initiation ceremony conducted within factory walls. A film for those interested in Far Eastern Studies and religion.

results.title: Sarongs and silver
results.creator_credit: Zain Hussain and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: The ancient folk-crafts of silk weaving and silver work as practiced on the East Coast of Malaya. A picturesque wedding celebration sequence serves to display pieces of elaborately worked silver.

results.title: Sardinian project
results.creator_credit: Jack Chambers, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Pet Company
results.brief_description: The incidence of malaria in Sardinia had become so high in 1946 that the Italian Government undertook a campaign to eradicate the malaria-bearing mosquito from the island. A special organization known as ERLAAS was set up and in 1947 an all-out effort was launched. All structures where the adult mosquito might be sheltering had to be sprayed with special emulsions. In an attempt to wipe out the larvae, every patch and pool of water was sprayed with DDT mixed with diesel oil, and marshy places were cleared and drained. By the end to 1948 the work was complete and as a result a new era in the life of the Sardinian people had begun.
